pr_title: Allow basic markup syntax custom previews

timeline.message:
Allow basic markup syntax custom previews

Add MarkdownFormatter using https://github.com/vsch/flexmark-java/ to format markdown.
To configure Markdown in custom previews add the "Markdown" formatter.
Markdown is enabled by default for the comment field as requested in https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/6194
Remove AssertJ in favor of plain JUnit5

Switch back to

instead of
for formatted text blocks
Reduce MarkdownFormatterTest.formatWhenFormattingComplexMarkupThenReturnsOnlyOneLine to actually test newlines only because the rest is covered elsewhere

timeline.bodyText: is requires annotations really necessary. I remember that I had a few problems with annotations vs jakarta.annotation in the past.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText: You're right it's not needed, I was tempted to put @NotNull annotations on parameters but removed them because it doesn't make sense to use them on one class only. Apparently forgot to remove the requires.
replies.author: AlexanderGirgis

timeline.bodyText: is the HTMLChars formatter still necessary or is the HtmlRenderer already taking care of it?
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText:
It's needed to be checked whether the HtmlRenderer does some "Magic". Without guessing, I would gess not...
The HTMLChars formatter does:
replies.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason not to simply replace \\format[HTMLChars]{\\comment} with \\format[Markdown,HTMLChars]{\\comment} (or \\format[Markdown]{\\comment} see above)? If the user changed the preview style a bit, then this replacement would still have the desired effect, right?
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText: My reasoning was to not force a different behavior on people who consciously changed their configuration. So I only changed it, when it's the unchanged default value. However this is a matter of opinion. How are changes like this normally handled in Jabref?
replies.author: AlexanderGirgis

replies.bodyText: I like the proposal by @tobiasdiez. It a) integrated the feature and b) focuses the update to the Comment field
replies.author: koppor

timeline.message: Remove annotations left behind by reverted change.
Narrow configuration migration to migrate customized preview configurations as well as suggested in review by @tobiasdiez and @koppor
Merge branch 'allow-basic-markup-in-comment-fixes-6194' of https://github.com/AlexanderGirgis/jabref into allow-basic-markup-in-comment-fixes-6194
